channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: One dead, dozens injured in Russian strikes on Ukraine's Pavlograd
item.description: Russian missile strikes on Pavlograd in central Ukraine killed one person and injured more than 50 others, including three children. Five Iskander ballistic missiles were fired, causing several fires in the city. This attack is part of increased Russian aerial assaults following Ukraine's cross-border offensive into Russia's Kursk region last month.

item.title: 'Terror threat': Indonesia arrests seven over failed plot to attack Pope Francis
item.description: Indonesian authorities have arrested seven individuals for issuing online terror threats against Pope Francis during his visit aimed at promoting religious unity. Heightened security measures include around 4,000 personnel to ensure the pope's safety. The suspects are accused of posting bomb threats on social media concerning the pope's public meetings in Jakarta.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan's capital reports first poliovirus case in last 16 years, 17 cases reported so far this year
item.description: Pakistan has confirmed its first polio case in Islamabad in over 16 years, marking the nation's 17th case this year. In response, a nationwide vaccination campaign will start on September 9, aiming to immunize over 33 million children under five. Authorities stress the need for parental cooperation to curb further outbreaks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' August fundraising hits $404 million, pushing her ahead of Trump
item.description: Kamala Harris's campaign and the Democratic Party raised $361 million in August, providing a financial advantage over Donald Trump with two months until Election Day. At the start of September, Harris had $404 million in cash on hand. Both candidates are projected to spend over $1 billion as they target key battleground states.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Revival of SAARC spirit can solve many regional problems: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Yunus
item.description: Muhammad Yunus, head of Bangladesh's interim government, advocates for reviving SAARC to tackle regional issues. He intends to meet Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the UN General Assembly and aims to gather SAARC leaders for a photo op. Yunus also seeks India's help in addressing the Rohingya crisis impacting Bangladesh.

item.title: 'Psychopath' sets girlfriend's parents' home on fire after dispute in New Jersey
item.description: In South Brunswick, Leonard Jones, 50, allegedly set fire to his girlfriend's parents' home after an argument. The incident took place around 3 a.m., prompting police response. All four residents managed to escape safely as the fire engulfed the house. Jones was subsequently arrested and charged with aggravated arson and domestic violence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Zelenskyy meets top military leaders in Germany as the US announces additional aid to Ukraine
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with U.S. military leaders and over 50 partner nations in Germany to push for more weapons support. The U.S. announced an additional $250 million in security aid for Ukraine. Discussions focused on air defense, artillery supplies, and enhancing Ukraine's defense industrial base as Zelenskyy seeks long-range strike capabilities.

item.title: 'School shooting.. I'm scared': Parents and students share heart-wrenching messages during Apalachee high attack in Georgia
item.description: A tragic shooting occurred at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, killing four people and injuring nine others. Students sent desperate texts to their parents during the lockdown. The alleged shooter is a 14-year-old student who now faces multiple charges. Victims include two teachers and two students.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Wanted to play like other children': Roller-skater Gaza girl’s life cut short in Israeli airstrike
item.description: Hussam Salah Abu Ajwa let his daughter Tala play outside in Gaza City, but an explosion killed her moments later. The conflict has ravaged the area, damaging schools and displacing families. UNRWA cautions that ongoing violence may result in a generation marked by resentment and extremism due to the prolonged conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Shinjiro Koizumi announces plan for early election if elected as Japan's new leader
item.description: Shinjiro Koizumi, former environment minister and top contender for Japan's prime ministerial post, announced plans to call an early election if victorious in the upcoming ruling party leadership race. He intends to maintain existing economic policies while bolstering economic strength. The LDP election on September 27 will decide the next prime minister.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Barron Trump: Donald's 'secret weapon' in fight for Gen Z votes in US presidential elections
item.description: Donald Trump is using his son Barron to attract Gen Z voters for the upcoming 2024 election. Barron's role includes engaging with digital platforms and influencers, enhancing Trump's connection with younger audiences. According to a SurveyUSA poll, Trump holds a lead over Kamala Harris among voters aged 18-34.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tesla driver arrested after being found asleep on autopilot with $100K in illegal drugs
item.description: Michael Goodman was arrested in Wilson’s Mills, North Carolina, for being asleep behind the wheel of his Tesla on Autopilot. Authorities found over $100,000 worth of illegal drugs in the vehicle. He faces multiple felony charges such as drug trafficking and reckless driving.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I've got your backs,' Taiwan president tells sailors on combat-ready warship
item.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te visited a combat-ready warship at the Penghu islands base in the Taiwan Strait, expressing support for sailors amid heightened tensions with Beijing. He emphasized unity within the navy and committed to improving military capabilities, highlighting their role in safeguarding Taiwanese security.

item.title: China on alert for super typhoon Yagi: All you need to know about the world's second-strongest storm of 2024
item.description: China is gearing up for Super Typhoon Yagi's landfall on Friday afternoon, impacting Guangdong and Hainan with strong winds, heavy rains, and coastal flooding. Over 410,000 residents have been evacuated. Shenzhen and Hainan officials caution about potential catastrophic damage, advocating for large-scale evacuations and emergency measures as transport services are suspended.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Impartial force' must be deployed to Sudan: UN experts
item.description: UN experts have urged for an independent force to protect millions of civilians displaced by Sudan's ongoing conflict between the national army and paramilitary forces. A fact-finding mission uncovered severe rights violations, including airstrikes on civilian targets and sexual violence, which may amount to war crimes. Immediate action is needed to safeguard affected populations.

item.title: NDP leader Jagmeet Singh ends liberal deal, cites major wins for Canadians: 'We accomplished a lot'
item.description: NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh announced the termination of the supply-and-confidence agreement with the Liberal government, citing significant achievements such as dental care and progress on national pharmacare. Singh criticized Prime Minister Trudeau for being overly influenced by corporate interests. An election appears more likely, with NDP decisions to be made on a vote-by-vote basis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pavel Durov’s first statement after arrest in France: 'Telegram is not perfect ... '
item.description: Telegram co-founder Pavel Durov, after being arrested in France, defended his platform against allegations of enabling criminal activity. He admitted Telegram's imperfections but stressed ongoing efforts to remove harmful content and enhance systems. Criticizing French authorities for personal accountability, he assured users of upcoming improvements to tackle misuse effectively.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: After 93 days Nasa's troubled Starliner setting stage for unpiloted return to Earth
item.description: Boeing's Starliner capsule is set to undock from the International Space Station on September 6, landing in New Mexico six hours later. Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams will remain on the ISS until February, returning aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon ferry ship. The mission encountered helium leaks and thruster issues but aims for a successful landing.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Vance: 'John McCain wouldn’t stand with Harris on border crisis', Trump's running mate responds to late senator's son endorsing Kamala
item.description: JD Vance, Republican vice presidential nominee, claimed that the late Sen. John McCain would not support Vice President Kamala Harris if he were alive to witness the current southern border situation. His remarks came after McCain's son endorsed Harris and registered as a Democrat. Vance stressed prioritizing voter opinions over family endorsements.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Rich Homie Quan? Rap star found foaming at mouth, pronounced dead at 34: What happened?
item.description: Atlanta rapper Rich Homie Quan, born Dequantes Devontay Lamar, was found dead at 34. The cause of death is yet to be determined, with an autopsy scheduled. Known for hits like 'Type of Way' and 'Flex,' his passing has left fans and the music industry in shock.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
